revised_title: Newton's Correspondence and Early Newtonianism in Italy
tldr: This article discusses a group of thirty previously unknown Newton letters, providing insight into Newton's relationships with foreign scientists during the last twenty to thirty years of his life. It also explores the spread of Newtonianism in Italy, with a focus on the connections between Newton and Italian mathematicians and scientists. The letters reveal Newton's active role in spreading his ideas and views on science, particularly in Italy, and his use of Italian visitors to carry his anti-Leibnizian campaign.
